item.title: All Pokémon Winds & Waves Starters—Every New Pokémon Gen 10 Starter, Explained
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon Winds and Waves was revealed to the world during the Pokémon Day showcase on February 27, including the first look at the Gen 10 starters.

Releasing as a Nintendo Switch 2 exclusive in 2027, Pokémon Winds and Waves is the tenth generation of the franchise and will bring a heap of new Pokémon into the fray.

While there were no new wild Pokémon revealed in the trailer, a detailed look at the Gen 10 starters was shown, and Insider Gaming has all the details.

What Are The Pokémon Winds & Waves Starters?

Browt

Browt is a small, angry-looking bird-type Pokémon that serves as the Grass starter in Winds and Waves, standing at a measly 0.3m tall and weighing 3.5kg. It is described as the ‘Bean Chick Pokémon’, with the Overgrow ability.

Bird-like starters are not a new concept for the Pokémon franchise, with Browt joining the likes of Torchic and Rowlet in the category.

Pombon

Pombon is a brown, dog-like Pokémon that resembles a pomeranian, though it’s mane has some lion similarities. Pombon is 0.4m tall and weighs 6.7kg.

Described as the “Puppy Pokémon,” Pombon has the Blaze ability, and joins a long list of dog-like Pokémon in the franchise’s history, including Growlithe and Arcanine, who are also Fire-type.

Gecqua

Gecqua is the Water-type starter in Pokémon Winds and Waves, standing at 0.3m tall and weighing 4.3kg. Described as the “Water Gecko Pokémon,” it has the Torrent ability.

Similarities will certainly be made with Treecko, another Gecko-like starter Pokémon from Ruby and Sapphire, but it’s a good choice to fit the environment of the game.

Do We Know The Evolved Forms of The Pokémon Wind & Waves Starters?

No further details are known about the Pokémon Winds and Waves starters, including their evolved forms, and reveals could be hidden until the game releases in 2027.

While there is certainly more to be shown from Pokémon Winds and Waves ahead of release, Pokémon always keeps a tight lid on major reveals like the fully-evolved forms of the starter Pokémon.

Additionally, the mid-evolution lines for the Gen 10 starters are unlikely to be shown until release, and spoilers will be at a minimum as the game is Nintendo Switch 2 exclusive, meaning it can’t be datamined.

Which is your favourite Pokémon Winds and Waves starter? Share your choice in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Pokémon, take a look at everything announced during Pokémon Day, and find out the release window for Pokémon Champions.

item.title: Pokémon Go Bringing Back ‘Almost All’ Pokémon For Anniversary Event
item.content:encoded:
Pokémon Go is going all-out in a special 30th anniversary event next month, bringing back “almost all” Pokémon that have ever appeared in the game.

Although details were not revealed for Pokémon Go‘s 10th anniversary, which takes place later this year, a 30th anniversary event next week brings back the majority of the Pokémon that have ever featured in the game.

Pokémon Go Announces 30th Anniversary: All Out Event

Following a brief teaser during the Pokémon Presents showcase, Niantic revealed full details on the 30th Anniversary: All Out event, which takes place Saturday, March 7, to Sunday, March 8.

From 10am local time on the Saturday to 8pm local time on the Sunday, “almost all” Pokémon that have ever appeared in Pokémon Go will appear in specific biomes.

While this brings back a host of Pokémon into rotation, there are some exceptions. Mythical Pokémon, Ultra Beasts, and species of Pokémon not normally found in the wild will not feature.

Additionally, certain Pokémon will continue to only be available in certain regions or hatchable from eggs, and costumed Pokémon will not appear in the wild.

Finally, for Pokémon with multiple forms, not all forms will appear in the wild.

What are your thoughts on the Pokémon Go 30th Anniversary: All Out event? Share your thoughts in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Pokémon, check out the reveal of Pokémon Wind & Waves, and take a look at everything announced during Pokémon Presents.
